item.title: Management Accountant
item.description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Management Accountant to join our Finance team in Colwick, Nottingham on a 12 month fixed term contract . Hillary’s are part of the Hunter Douglas group, so as a fast-growing company this role has become available to offer the successful applicant the opportunity to further their career in finance.

Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager – Finance, you’ll be supporting the Operations Management Accountants team to supply financial analysis across the manufacturing and technical areas of Hunter Douglas UK. You’ll be responsible for month end processes, internal & group operational reporting, and analysis on operational performance across all business channels.

This role is ideal for anyone who’s part or fully qualified with management accounting experience.

Management Accountant Key responsibilities:

  • Report and analyse manufacturing & operational performance across all business channels including Direct Labour, Product Quality/Waste and Overheads (including their financial implications).
  • Support the management accounting / business partnering functions.
  • Variance analysis reporting.
  • Ownership of month end processes.
  • Balance sheet reconciliations.
  • Budgeting and forecasting for operational areas.
  • Support audit, statutory reporting and due diligence requirements as required.
  • Support SOX compliance.
  • Wider project work with manufacturing, technical and samples departments.

Interested in the role? Here is what we are looking for.

  • A graduate with a numerate degree, or AAT qualified is preferable.
  • Confident using Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Self-motivated, with the ability to manage your own time and productivity to achieve deadlines and targets.
  • Able to take on board and develop skills according to feedback and have a positive, problem-solving attitude.

This role is hybrid, with three days in the office and two at home. You’ll be joining a friendly team and working with experienced individuals with the opportunity to learn and develop in your finance career.

You’ll receive many benefits, such as generous staff discount (including for your family and friends!), and a healthcare and lifestyle benefits package.

Everyone who applies will receive a response.

item.title: Designate Business Development Manager
item.description:
Could you be one of our future managers? Do you envision yourself as a future leader? If so, look no further!

We have an incredible opportunity to join our team and be part of our Management Designate Programme, based in Dublin, Ireland. Whether you’ve just completed your studies or you’re ready to embark on a career journey, our Management Designate Programme is tailor-made to equip you with the skills and knowledge necessary for you to apply for future management roles across our dynamic business.

As part of the Hunter Douglas group, this is a fantastic chance to join a rapidly expanding and market-leading enterprise. You’ll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in various business functions across multiple brands, gaining valuable insights and experiences. From understanding the end-to-end customer journey to training and operating within our vibrant Contact Centre, this programme ensures you’ll have a comprehensive understanding of our operations.

In addition, you will have an insight into Business Development Manager duties, exploring and understanding our self-employed advisor network. You’ll gain a complete understanding of our market-leading products and engage in selling and installing them. This programme also includes field training, including visits to customers’ homes, giving you a well-rounded perspective of our business. Throughout the programme, you’ll be provided training in all areas of management, ready for you to apply for a management position.

Why should you consider this role? Here are just a few reasons:

  1. Career Progression: Grow your career by joining a company renowned for its commitment to innovation and excellence. This programme is specifically designed to fast track you to be in a position to apply for management positions throughout the business.
  2. Make an impact: Take on a key position within our Sales and Service department and demonstrate how you can really make a difference.  
  3. Celebrate success: You’ll be joining a supportive team that encourage progression, champion training and development and continually look to improve.

Interested in the role? Here’s what we’re looking for:

Candidates with exceptional written and verbal communication skills, as well as high proficiency in the suite of Microsoft, including Microsoft Teams. You’ll be a confident presenter with a commercial mind-set, demonstrating tenacity, determination, enthusiasm and an eye for detail. You’ll have the drive to get stuck in, learn as much as possible and have the ability to manage your time and productivity effectively. We value ambition, and encourage and support your personal development from your first day with us. Your open-mindedness to feedback, coupled with a positive problem-solving attitude, will set you on the path to success.

This is an opportunity to join an ambitious business that will continue to go from strength to strength, joining a supportive team.

Interviews will consist of two stages.

Everyone who applies will receive a response.

item.title: Despatch Operative
item.description:
Are you an effective communicator who can work from your own initiative and foster collaborative working relationships? An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Despatch Operative to join our Despatch team at our Glaisdale site.

This is a permanent late shift position working between the hours of 10am – 6:45pm, in this role, you are responsible for the sortation and onward movement of products by date, and the loading and unloading of the inter-site vehicle. Attention to detail and understanding of the product is really important – the products need handling with care to avoid damage. This is a physical job, so if you like being active during your working day, then this is the place to be!

We work as part of a close team, we believe that teamwork is key to getting the job done and loving what you do.

We distribute on behalf of the businesses that sit under the Hunter Douglas Group UK umbrella - Hillarys, Thomas Sanderson, Custom West, and Arena.

About You

Are you the ideal candidate? Here’s what we are looking for…

  • Previous experience in a similar environment is desirable.
  • Attention to detail is essential.
  • Basic numeracy and literacy skills.
  • Strong communication skills – you will be required to communicate effectively with your colleagues and department leader.
  • Basic IT knowledge.
  • The ability to work from your own initiative.
  • The ability to demonstrate full ownership of tasks and errors.

If you have a positive attitude to your work, good attention to detail and are able to build great working relationships, then we would love to hear from you!

You’ll receive many benefits, such as discounted gym memberships, generous staff discount (including family and friends!), healthcare and lifestyle benefits packages, and a fantastic working environment.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. If you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for you to attend an interview, please do let us know and we will be happy to accommodate.

Everyone that applies will receive a response.

item.title: Digital Data Executive
item.description:
Are you an ambitious analyst seeking hands-on experience in digital data? We have a fantastic opportunity for a passionate individual to join our market-leading marketing team as a Digital Data Executive. This hybrid role, based in Colwick, Nottingham, offers a unique chance to work closely with both internal teams and external agencies, gaining invaluable experience in digital data analytics.

As part of Hillarys, a division of the Hunter Douglas group of companies, you will contribute to the digital analytics for a global portfolio of over 30 brands. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career in a dynamic and fast-growing industry.

You will be responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting data from web analytics and digital campaigns, providing valuable, actionable insights to optimise the customer journey. A solid understanding of Google Analytics will help you hit the ground running, though full training will be provided. You’ll also collaborate with our contacts at Pinterest, Meta, and Google to create innovative ways to track and measure media performance on our websites.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Digital Analytics & Tagging: Develop and maintain digital analytics metrics, tracking, and tagging for website traffic across multiple brands.
  • Cookie Consent Management: Ensure compliance with evolving privacy regulations and manage cookie consent for various digital properties.
  • Reporting & Visualisation: Generate reports and visualisations that offer actionable insights into user behaviour, campaign performance, and conversion metrics.
  • Performance Optimisation: Assist in improving digital performance through A/B testing, conversion funnel analysis, and recommended optimisations.
  • Analytics Configuration: Configure tools such as Google Analytics 4 to ensure accurate data collection and reporting.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with teams including Web, SEO, PPC, Insight, and Social to align data analytics with broader marketing strategies.

About You:

  • Analytical Mindset: A natural problem-solver with a "can-do" attitude, comfortable with interpreting and analysing complex data sets.
  • Detail-Oriented: Meticulous attention to detail, particularly in ensuring compliance and accuracy in data collection.
  • Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration with both internal teams and external partners.
  • Technical Know-How: A solid understanding of Google Analytics and Looker Studio. Familiarity with Google Tag Manager is a plus, though full training will be provided.

You’ll receive many benefits, such as discounted gym memberships, generous staff discount (including family and friends!), healthcare and lifestyle benefits packages, and a fantastic working environment.

Hillarys is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. If you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for you to attend an interview, please do let us know and we will be happy to accommodate.

Everyone will receive a response.

item.title: S&OP Analyst
item.description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an S&OP Analyst to join our team in Colwick, Nottingham. Hillarys are part of the Hunter Douglas group, so as a fast-growing company this role has become available to offer the successful applicant the opportunity to further their career.

Working as part of the Supply Chain team, the S&OP Analyst will have responsibility for evolving the S&OP Process. Improving key performance metrics across the business, including forecast accuracy, inventory control, and operational efficiencies. Championing cross-functional engagement with core departments and business leaders you will facilitate each S&OP meeting to ensure business alignment and successful delivery of the plan. The S&OP Analyst is responsible for producing consolidated reports that are fit for purpose in a matrix organisation and presented in a user-friendly way.

S&OP Analyst Key responsibilities:

  • Support the overall S&OP Process through cross functional collaboration, including regular meetings to coordinate, review and update forecasts, inventory levels and production plans.
  • Review and analyse forecast vs actual demand, ensuring capacity and demand deviations are understood and managed effectively.
  • Monitor forecast accuracy, planning data integrity, and overall S&OP performance and make recommendations for improvement.
  • Develop and implement S&OP best practices and continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Support implementation of new forecasting tool.
  • Work with the Material Controllers and Product Managers to monitor inventory levels and support inventory optimisation.
  • Collaborate with production, procurement, and logistics teams to align production schedules with sales forecasts and inventory plans.
  • Track KPIs related to volume forecast, stock, production, and warehouse capacities.
  • Prepare and present regular reports to senior management and the wider Supply Chain teams, highlighting performance, risks, and opportunities.
  • Facilitate communication and collaboration between all departments.

Interested in the role? Here’s what we’re looking for:

  • 2-3 years’ experience in Supply Chain and/or execution of S&OP related processes
  • Preferably worked in an environment of both manufactured and sourced finished goods
  • Excellent communication and influencing skills.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Great relationship building skills across a range of stakeholders.
  • Strong knowledge and experience working with SAP ERP System
  • Intermediate Microsoft Excel Skills

You’ll receive many benefits, such as discounted gym memberships, generous staff discount (including family and friends!), healthcare and lifestyle benefits packages, and a fantastic working environment.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. If you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for you to attend an interview, please do let us know and we will be happy to accommodate.

Everyone that applies will receive a response.

item.title: PR Executive
item.description:
Are you an ambitious PR professional ready to take the next step in your career?

As a PR Executive, you will play a pivotal role in our Brand Engagement Team, reporting directly to the PR Manager. You will be responsible for leading the day-to-day management of our influencer programme, responding to media requests, supporting our link building project and developing proactive media outreach strategies. This is an exciting opportunity to enhance our PR efforts and contribute to our overall marketing objectives within a fast-paced, dynamic organisation.

Here is what you will be doing:

  • Lead the day-to-day operations of our influencer programme, including identifying potential partnerships, managing relationships, and coordinating product gifting initiatives.
  • Respond to media inquiries promptly and professionally, ensuring that all requests are addressed effectively.
  • Develop and execute creative ideas for proactive media outreach, including pitches and story angles that align with our brand messaging.
  • Collaborate with the SEO team to generate ideas for link-building strategies that enhance our online visibility.
  • Assist in planning and executing PR campaigns, ensuring they are aligned with overall marketing goals.
  • Write compelling press releases, media briefs, and editorial content that resonate with target audiences.
  • Monitor and report on PR performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.

Interested in the role? Here is what we are looking for.

  • A minimum of one year of experience in PR, either in-house or at an agency, with a proven track record of managing media relationships and campaigns.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to craft engaging content and effectively convey brand messages.
  • An innovative and proactive approach in generating ideas for media outreach and influencer engagement.
  • Strong time management and organisational abilities, with the capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Be comfortable using data to measure success and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • A team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment and works well with cross-functional teams.

Why join us?

Take your PR career to the next level with opportunities for growth and professional development within a global leader in the industry. As part of the Hunter Douglas group, you’ll have the chance to work across multiple brands and advance in a fast-paced, dynamic organisation.

Make a significant contribution to our PR strategy and influence the perception of our brand in the market.

You’ll receive many benefits, such as generous staff discount (including family and friends!), healthcare and lifestyle packages, and a fantastic working environment.

Application Process!

To apply please fill in the application form along with your CV and a cover letter detailing your experience and motivation for this role. 

Everyone who applies will receive a response.

item.title: Paid Media Executive
item.description:
Are you an experienced Paid Media Executive? Are you looking to join a market-leading company? We have an exciting opportunity for a Paid Media Executive to join our award-winning Marketing team based in Colwick, Nottingham.

Here is what you will be doing:

  • Management of the day to day paid media activity, working closely with our media agencies and international teams.
  • Analysing data with a keen eye for detail and creating something actionable from your findings.
  • Working closely with the web, social, data and design teams to share learnings and help make improvements across the customer journey.
  • Writing and testing engaging ad copy.
  • Planning and forecasting paid media spend, leads and sales.
  • Managing the paid media budget each month and monitoring performance at product and segment level.
  • Reporting back on performance internally to the wider marketing team and group.
  • Working closely with Google/Meta to test new Google/Meta products.

Interested in the role? Here is what we are looking for.

  • A minimum of 1-2 years paid media experience, either in-house or at an agency.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to multitask and prioritise workload effectively.
  • Experience of Google Ads, Bing Ads, SA360 and Meta.
  • Competent user of Microsoft Excel
  • Enthusiastic, keen to add value to the business and develop personally.

Why join us?  

Take on a key role in our dynamic and results-orientated digital team and have a lasting impact on our stakeholders by establishing effective working relationships. Contribute to driving our international brands forward through sharing best practice and managing their PPC accounts. Grow your career in digital marketing, by joining a market-leading organisation, renowned for its commitment to innovation and excellence. We excel in nurturing the career development of those who join us and are passionate about what they do.

You’ll receive many benefits, such as generous staff discount (including family and friends!), healthcare and lifestyle packages, and a fantastic working environment.

We understand that there is no ‘one size fits all’ approach, and with this in mind, we are dedicated to providing an inclusive workplace where every colleague feels valued and comfortable to be their true self. If you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, please do let us know and we will be happy to accommodate.

Please note, the recruitment process for this will consist of two stages of interviews, which will include a task and presentation.

Everyone who applies will receive a response.
